meanings.definition: Devout (adjective): having or showing deep religious feeling or commitment
meanings.sent1: She is a devout believer who attends church every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: The devout monk prayed quietly in the chapel.
meanings.sent3: The devout nun accidentally dropped her prayer book during mass.
meanings.sent4: His devout dedication to his faith shone brightly in his actions.
meanings.sent5: The image of the devout pilgrim kneeling in prayer was etched in her mind.

meanings.definition: Devout (adverb): in a devout manner, with deep religious feeling or commitment
meanings.sent1: She prayed devoutly before every meal, thanking the heavens.
meanings.sent2: The choir sang devoutly during the religious ceremony.
meanings.sent3: He bowed devoutly to the statue of the patron saint, hoping for luck.
meanings.sent4: The candles flickered devoutly in the dimly lit church.
meanings.sent5: The old man smiled devoutly as he listened to the hymns, feeling at peace.
